title: Interesting problem often faced in practice
review:
Summary
========
The paper addresses the problem of irregular spacing in sequential data with five different irregularity types. The solution is based on modifying LSTM cell.

Comment
========
Irregular and multiple spacing presents in many real world applications with time-stamped events. The problem is therefore important to address properly. However, I found the evaluation of the proposed solution is less convincing. The main results in Figure 5 are not informative. 

There have been related works addressing irregular and multiple spacing (not just missing data as cited in the paper):

- Pham, T., Tran, T., Phung, D., & Venkatesh, S. (2016, April). DeepCare: A deep dynamic memory model for predictive medicine. In Pacific-Asia Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining (pp. 30-41). Springer, Cham.
- Koutnik, J., Greff, K., Gomez, F., & Schmidhuber, J. (2014). A clockwork RNN. arXiv preprint arXiv:1402.3511.
- Chen, C., Kim, S., Bui, H., Rossi, R., Koh, E., Kveton, B., & Bunescu, R. (2018, October). Predictive Analysis by Leveraging Temporal User Behavior and User Embeddings. In Proceedings of the 27th ACM International Conference on Information and Knowledge Management (pp. 2175-2182). ACM.
rating: 4: Ok but not good enough - rejection
confidence: 4: The reviewer is confident but not absolutely certain that the evaluation is correct
